title: [feature request] `baddbmm` (and `bmm`, `addbmm`) with swap aixs
body_html:
currently, these bmms require the input with [k, n, m] x [k, m, p] shape, and product [k, n, p] output.

It that possible to support the swap of first two axis in the first input, so that it is the [n, k, m], and product the [n, k, p] outputs ?

I know it can be done by permute, but it is somehow not efficient.
Another solution is use matmul by reshape the first input to [n, k, 1, m], but it often met OOM error, and much slower.

body:
currently, these `bmm`s require the input with [k, n, m] x [k, m, p] shape, and product [k, n, p] output.

It that possible to support the swap of first two axis in the first input, so that it is the [n, k, m], and product the [n, k, p] outputs ? 

I know it can be done by permute, but it is somehow not efficient.
Another solution is  use matmul by reshape the first input to [n, k, 1, m], but it often met OOM error, and much slower.
